title: Thunderbird data disappeared on Ubuntu upgrade
content: I upgraded my Ubuntu 22.04 OS to Ubuntu 24.04, all went well except for Thunderbird which was completely removed! When I try to install it my previous password is refused. I was able to reset it but none of my data (inbox messages, addresses etc ) are there. I also use an extended support version of Ubuntu 16.04 and have Thunderbird still working there perfectly. When I originally installed Ubuntu 22.04 I had no problem with password refusal or all my data not being imported from U16. Can you please advise, Derek

title: inicio en segundo plano

title: The task reminder window does not appear
content:
Windows: Win11 24H2 Thunderbird: Version 139.0.1

The screenshot shows the reminder window. The window appeared, I enter sleep on the computer, come out of sleep, there is no window. The same thing happens if I close Thunderbird (with a cross in the upper right corner) and then launch it. And the same thing happens after the computer is turned off and on.

What actions have I done to understand the problem: 1) deleted the profile and created a new empty one, i.e. profile files have no effect on this; 2) reinstalled Thunderbird.

The problem started 3-4 days ago. The problem may have occurred after the Thunderbird program update - the update was on June 2.

title: Thunderbird hangs attempting to load very large emails
content:
We receive very large text emails from logwatch on one of our servers. Thunderbird becomes unresponsive for several minutes. When it "comes back" other messages can be selected but no content is displayed, and everything is slow to respond. Clicking the X to close the app takes upwards of 30 seconds to actually close the app.

Is there some setting to increase heap / RAM? Or is this a different issue?

title: Travamento na nova versão
content: Prezados, bom dia. Na semana passada, meu aplicativo Thunderbird (versão Desktop) solicitou uma atualização para a versão 128.11.0esr (64 bits). Após realizar a atualização, o desempenho do aplicativo piorou significativamente — está lento para abrir e-mails e frequentemente trava. Outros colaboradores da minha empresa que também realizaram a atualização estão enfrentando os mesmos problemas. Gostaria de saber se há outros relatos semelhantes por parte dos usuários? Existe a possibilidade de reinstalarmos a versão anterior? Caso sim, poderiam nos encaminhar o instalador (arquivo .exe) por e-mail para **[andrey.silva@cedrotech.com]? Agradeço desde já pela atenção.

title: Login to server pop.windstream.net with username ----- failed
content:
In the past month or two I have been dealing with a constantly recurring issue with Thunderbird getting my emails. Login to server pop.windstream.net with username ----- failed, and then it gives me the option to retry, enter new password, or cancel. 99% of the time, when I hit retry, my email downloads just fine. But I have multiple email accounts that I have to go through the same song and dance on every time I try to download my messages. Sometimes one or more of my email addresses will check and download ok... sometimes all of them will... sometimes none of them will. But choosing the retry option usually yields me good results so it doesn't appear that I have something in my settings that is wrong?? And usually if I shut down of Thunderbird and a restart of it, all email addresses will down;load perfectly the first time I try.

I wonder if it doesn't correlate with a Thunderbird update? I keep hoping that the issue will be resolved as quickly as it came through another update or something but it's been long enough to really start driving me crazy now so can you help me? What is going on with the normally smoothe and agreeable Thunderbird on my very same computer using the very same email addresses all of a sudden?
creator: pegp

title: Thunderbird not displaying emails in Gmail Inbox
content: Emails were not appearing in the Thunderbird (v128.11.0esr (64-bit), on a Windows 10 laptop) Inbox from a newly opened Gmail account (though they did appear in All Mail). The Gmail account was opened with default options, and it was added to Thunderbird with default options. They did appear in the Gmail app on an Android phone, but with the label 'Primary' rather than 'Inbox'. Investigation of Gmail accessed via a web browser showed that the Inbox contained four tabs: 'Primary', 'Promotions', 'Social' and 'Updates'. Doing Get started with Gmail > Customize your inbox > Default > Customize allowed me to "Deselect all categories to go back to your old inbox". This didn't fix Thunderbird (even though I forced a Get New Messages for) but, after I'd blundered around a bit more, it started working. So, I'm not sure whether I did something else to fix it, or it just took several minutes to start working. Also, the Android phone now shows 'Inbox' rather than 'Primary'. Question: Is there a way of sorting this out at the Thunderbird end, without having to make setup changes at the Gmail end? It would be very useful if Thunderbird could sort this out automatically when we add a Gmail account. Until then, it would be useful if your solution or, if no solution, my work-around could be publicised in Help. Thank You
creator: bhardy1954

title: Thunderbird is defaulting to plain text for email composition
content:
Hello all!

I use Thunderbird's desktop application for work. The problem that I'm having with Thunderbird is in regards to email composition. Every email defaults to plain text (new emails, replies, etc.) despite the following: settings > composition > sending format: "HTML only." I have restarted the application as well as my computer to allow for any setting changes to take effect.

I would prefer rich text or HTML, especially since my signature is in HTML format and it looks awful in plain text.

Please let me know what additional information I can provide. Thank you in advance for your help!
creator: ltwolle
